category: Member sport group regulations/Article 35 (Objections and Audits)
contents: Article 35 (Objections and Audits) ① City/provincial sports organizations must immediately report to the member sports organizations the approval of the articles of incorporation of the city/provincial sports association and matters approved by the president, and the member sports organizations must report any matters to be corrected among the reported matters. If it is determined that there is a problem, correction can be requested from the relevant city/provincial sports council by presenting the relevant facts in detail within 14 days. Revised 2021. 10. 6. ② The city/provincial sports council must process the request for correction within 14 days from the date of receipt, and if it is not clear, the sports council's decision must be followed. Revised on October 6, 2021. ③ When a member sports organization deems it necessary, it may investigate and audit the overall organizational operation, business, and accounting work of the city/provincial sports organization. ④ If a member sports organization finds work-related misconduct or neglect of duties as a result of the investigation or audit pursuant to paragraph 3, the member sports organization may request disciplinary action against the relevant executive or employee from the city/provincial sports organization. In this case, city/provincial sports organizations must follow this unless there are special reasons.
